translated: Jātaka
Catukkanipāta
Kāliṅgavagga🔽The birth-story of Sīlavīmaṁsaka
“There is no such thing as privacy,
for one who does evil deeds;
The forest creatures see him,
and the fool thinks he is alone.
I do not see myself,
and there is no such thing as emptiness;
Where I do not see another,
that is empty for me.”
“The difficult-to-accompany and the easy-to-accompany,
Nanda and Sukhavaḍḍhī,
The doctor and the one of impermanent character,
they abandoned the Dhamma for the sake of wealth.
How does the brahmin abandon,
who has gone beyond all things;
He who follows the Dhamma,
the mindful one who has gone forth in truth.”
The birth-story of Sīlavīmaṁsaka is the fifth.
